Detailed Description

Contains and handles a multipart mime message.

Member Function Documentation

void MimeMessage::add (  MimePart *  part  ) 
 

Add part to mail.

Parameters:
part The part to add, is stored and deleted by this MimeMessage.

MimePart* MimeMessage::createMimePartForFile (  const char *  fileName,
byte *  buff,
uint32  buffLength,
const char *  contentLocation,
bool  copyLocation,
MimePartText::characterSet  defaultCharacterSet = MimePartText::CHARSET_ISO_8859_1
)  [static]
 

Tries to make a MimePart of right type with right content type from a file name.

Parameters:
fileName The files name. The extension of the file name is used to make content-type.
buff The buffer with the data to add.
buffLength The length of buff.
contentLocation The URI of the content. If empty string then no location is set for the part.
copyLocation If the contentLocation string should be copied or just keep a pointer to it.
defaultCharacterSet The character set to default to.

const char* MimeMessage::getBoundaryText (   )  const
 

The mime boundary text.

Returns:
The unique boundary text for this message.

const char* MimeMessage::getContentType (   )  const
 

The content type of the entire message.

Returns:
A string with the content type.

char* MimeMessage::getMimeMessageBody (  bool  contentLocation = false  )  const
 

Creates a new buffer with the current content of the message.

Parameters:
contentLocation If to add Content-Location or Content-ID, default Content-ID.
Returns:
A new buffer with the message body.

const MimePart * MimeMessage::getMimePart (  uint32  i  )  const [inline]
 

Get a MimePart.

Returns:
The MimePart at index i.

void MimeMessage::setMainContentType (  const char *  contentType  ) 
 

Sets the main content's type, eg.

"text/html".

Parameters:
contentType The main content's type.

void MimeMessage::setPlaintextMessage (  const char *  plainText,
bool  copyPlainText = false
) 
 

Set the plaintext version of this message.

This is only shown if the mail client doesn't handles multipart mime messages. The default plaintext tells that the message is a multipart mime message.

Parameters:
plainText The plainText version of the message.
copyPlainText If the plainText should be copied or not, default false.
